messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Hoan tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Rich; Your picture of the plate looks like a Hoan piece. The ones I have are also very thin plates, less than 2 mm thick. The kozuka and kogai hitsu on your
messages.messageBody:
Hi Rich;

Your picture of the plate looks like a Hoan piece.

The ones I have are also very thin plates, less than 2 mm thick.

The kozuka and kogai hitsu on your tsuba have a different cut and shape however than on any of mine.

Nice tsuba.

John
----- Original Message -----
From: alchemyst
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, March 28, 2004 4:34 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Hoan tsuba


I'm trying to determine if a tsuba is a Hoan school or not.

Compare this from Toso Suran:

http://home.earthlink.net/~ttstein/hoan.jpg

with mine

http://home.earthlink.net/~ttstein/hoan2.jpg

Note the tagane mei and the folding line to the
right of the nakago ana. Think mine may be Hoan or
not? If not, then what school?

Any thoughts appreciated.

Rich S
